evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: On July 21, 2025, petitioner Carlos Osorto filed an ex parte application for release from immigration custody pending adjudication of his habeas petition. Docket no. 111.

extracted.value: Petitioner Carlos Osorto filed an ex parte application for release from immigration custody pending adjudication of his habeas petition on July 21, 2025 (docket no. 111).

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: Respondents filed an opposition (“Opp.”) the following day, supported by the declaration of Pauline H. Alarcon (“Alarcon Decl.”) and exhibits. Docket no. 113.

extracted.value: Respondents filed an opposition to the application on July 22, 2025 (docket no. 113), supported by the declaration of Pauline H. Alarcon and exhibits.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: The court held a telephonic conference regarding the application on July 23, 2025. Docket no. 115.

extracted.value: The court held a telephonic conference regarding the application on July 23, 2025 (docket no. 115).

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: Respondents thereafter filed a supplemental opposition on July 25, 2025 (“Supp. Opp.”). Docket no. 125.

extracted.value: Respondents filed a supplemental opposition on July 25, 2025 (docket no. 125).

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: On July 26, 2025, petitioner filed a reply brief supported by a supplemental declaration of Tolchin (“Supp. Tolchin Decl.”).

extracted.value: Petitioner filed a reply brief on July 26, 2025, supported by a supplemental declaration of Stacy Tolchin.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that petitioner Osorto’s ex parte application for release (docket no. 111) is GRANTED. Petitioner Carlos Osorto shall be immediately released from immigration custody subject to the posting of a $5,000 bond, and subject to the condition that he be placed on location monitoring with an ankle monitor.

extracted.value: Court ordered that petitioner be released from custody upon the posting of a $5,000 bond, with condition of ankle monitor, on July 30, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: Therefore, the court finds it has the inherent authority to grant bail pending resolution of a habeas petition in the immigration context.

extracted.value: The court found it has inherent authority to grant bail pending resolution of a habeas petition in the immigration context.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: Here, petitioner Osorto’s challenge to his detention is separate from any removal proceedings. Indeed, the immigration regulations recognize that a bond determination is separate and apart from deportation or removal proceedings.

extracted.value: The petitioner’s challenge to detention is separate from any removal proceedings; immigration regulations recognize bond determination is separate.

evidence.text: Since June 6, 2025, Defendants have been conducting “Operation At Large” in Los Angeles.

extracted.value: Since June 6, 2025, Defendants have been conducting “Operation At Large” in Los Angeles.

evidence.text: On June 6, 2025, federal law enforcement arrived in Los Angeles to participate in what federal officials have described as “the largest Mass Deportation Operation…in History.”

extracted.value: On June 6, 2025, federal law enforcement arrived in Los Angeles to participate in what federal officials have described as “the largest Mass Deportation Operation…in History.”

evidence.text: Here, the district court’s decision to award temporary preliminary relief relied on factual determinations about the effects that potential remedies would have and whether various remedies would be sufficient to ...

extracted.value: The district court’s decision to award temporary preliminary relief relied on factual determinations about the effects that potential remedies would have and whether various remedies would be sufficient to rectify alleged harms.
